stream_context.summary: Kaze programs the new “thimble guy” enemy for Course 14, live-debugs a tricky texture-scroll bug, and play-tests Biobak’s large rework of Course 1 while discussing future content, star counts, and release ideas.

development_findings.summary: Thimble guys (shy-guy variants made from metal thimbles) now chase Mario, perform a dive attack, and can be defeated only by kicking them off ledges bully-style; squishing was rejected because thimbles are hard material.
development_findings.quote: I need a different way of doing that… Kick them while they're on the side, they will roll… I'm okay with them being unbeatable.

development_findings.summary: After testing, Kaze settles on giving thimble guys knock-back physics similar to bullies so the player must back-stab and kick them, especially near pits.
development_findings.quote: You kind of have to backstab them. That's a really fun way to fight them.

development_findings.summary: A shader-like head-shine for the thimble guy was implemented via environment-mapped UV scrolling; a compiler shadowing bug initially prevented the tile-scroll from working.
development_findings.quote: This is why you don't trust your compiler… variable shadowing killed it.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s Course 1 rework removes 220 triangles and seven materials, adds new sky, windmill, and foliage, and still hits ~60 FPS on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: Considering it is the same performance, this is overall gonna be better.

development_findings.summary: Kaze wants the overworld to be the full 360° of Yoshi’s Island so progression feels like delving deeper into a single cohesive land.
development_findings.quote: It is super important that the overworld is the entirety of Yoshi's Island.

development_findings.summary: Planned content scope: 15 main courses, ~135 regular stars, plus 45 optional 'Yoshi Stars' with special restrictions such as limited A-press runs.
development_findings.quote: There's gonna be four stars where it limits your A presses… 11 types of Yoshi stars in total.

development_findings.summary: A second Course 14 enemy, based on Bert the Bashful (painted egg with cardboard feet), will hop toward the player and bounce Mario backwards instead of causing damage, exploiting the level’s many pits.
development_findings.quote: When he touches you, he doesn't deal damage. He bounces you back.

development_findings.summary: Kaze actively optimizes for cache misses and keeps related behaviors in a single inc.c file to improve performance.
development_findings.quote: I always keep all the behaviors for one thing close—less cache misses, which is good.

development_findings.summary: Future videos planned: a BLJ explainer, an updated Missing Link re-release, and bite-sized Mario 64 fact compilations to grow the channel.
development_findings.quote: That's the kind of slop YouTube viewers love and I think we can get famous that way.

development_findings.summary: He plans to sell a separate OST cartridge and will consult a lawyer about legalities before release.
development_findings.quote: Releasing it on a cartridge would be the coolest thing ever… I will probably talk to a lawyer before I release RTYI.

context_findings.summary: Kaze moved from Germany to Canada in 2021 to escape German bureaucracy and now codes in C++ professionally.
context_findings.quote: I'm so glad I don't live in Germany anymore… all the bureaucracy bullshit.

context_findings.summary: Balancing full-time job, workouts, and streams is difficult; he may stream half-workdays and even broadcast workouts or breaks.
context_findings.quote: At some point during the stream I just have to continue my workout… that's usually why I quit.

context_findings.summary: He sees instrument playing (e.g., guitar at parties) as a mere 'party trick,' hinting at a pragmatic, anti-show-off philosophy.
context_findings.quote: Learning to play an instrument is just a party trick.

context_findings.summary: Discusses YouTube growth pragmatically—willing to make broader, less technical videos to reach a bigger audience.
context_findings.quote: I'm just gonna make more generic videos that are not just for tech nerds.

biobak.summary: Delivered a major Course 1 rework with fewer polygons, new textures, optimized backgrounds, and a detailed changelog; will supply screenshots for Patreon.
biobak.quote: Quick facts: 220 fewer tries, 7 fewer materials—that is insane.

biobak.summary: Promises all materials now export without format errors so Kaze won't need to fix textures manually.
biobak.quote: All material export without error, but look at the whole model before importing as usual.

badub.summary: Composed a new track for Course 14; Kaze feels it sounds more like 'beach at sunset' and lacks a hummable melody, so further iteration is likely.
badub.quote: It doesn't fit the vibe… I'm also kinda missing the melody that you can hum along to.

zeina.summary: Kaze and Zeina have been playing Minecraft together (~4.5 hours in) as a casual pastime.
zeina.quote: I have started playing Minecraft for the first time recently with Zeina.

key_stories.title: Compiler Shadowing Bug Blocks Thimble-Guy Shine
key_stories.summary: While adding a moving specular highlight to the thimble enemy, Kaze found the texture wouldn't move at all. Deep diving into MIPS assembly revealed GCC had shadowed a pointer, nullifying the tile-scroll.
key_stories.challenge: Head-shine decal refused to animate despite correct GFX commands.
key_stories.process: Tested in PJ64 and Nemu, manually edited display lists, then inspected compiled assembly to trace the issue.
key_stories.outcome: Discovered a variable-shadowing error produced by the compiler; renaming fixed the bug and the shine now scrolls.
key_stories.key_quote: This is why you don't trust your compiler… variable shadowing killed it.

key_stories.title: Course 1 Gets a Performance-Friendly Makeover
key_stories.summary: Biobak rebuilt Course 1 with fewer triangles, new skyboxes, and simplified foliage. Kaze live-loaded the rework and confirmed it still runs at roughly 60 FPS on actual N64 hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Original Course 1 had overdraw and polycount issues, risking frame-rate drops.
key_stories.process: Biobak reduced geometry, consolidated materials, and replaced expensive trees with flat textures; Kaze imported and benchmarked.
key_stories.outcome: Performance matched the previous build while visuals improved, green-lighting the rework for the upcoming demo.
key_stories.key_quote: Nevermind, it's the same performance—this is overall gonna be better.
